title: Teaching Physics
alt: Space-time is like some simple and familiar system which is both intuitively understandable and precisely analogous, and if I were Richard Feynman I'd be able to come up with it.
transcript:
Cueball: Understanding gravity: Space-time is like a rubber sheet. Massive objects distort the sheet, and-
Student: Wait.Student: They distort it because they're pulled down by... what?Cueball: sighCueball: Space-time is like this set of equations, for which any analogy must be an approximation.
Student: Boooooring.
